Goal: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
Targets: By 2030, eradicate extreme poverty for all people everywhere, currently measured as people living on less than $1.25 a day.
Other Related Major Departments: Urban Development, Agriculture, Horticulture, Animal Husbandry.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of the population below the international poverty line, disaggregated by sex, age group, employment status and geographical location (urban/rural).

Goal: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
Targets: By 2030, reduce at least by half the proportion of men, women and children of all ages living in poverty in all its dimensions according to national definitions.
Other Related Major Departments: Urban Development, Agriculture, Horticulture, Animal Husbandry.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of the population living below the national poverty line, disaggregated by sex and age group

Goal: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
Targets: By 2030, reduce at least by half the proportion of men, women and children of all ages living in poverty in all its dimensions according to national definitions.
Other Related Major Departments: Urban Development, Agriculture, Horticulture, Animal Husbandry.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of men, women and children of all ages living in poverty in all its dimensions according to national definitions.

Goal: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
Targets: Implement nationally appropriate social protection systems and measures for all, including floors, and by 2030 achieve substantial coverage of the poor and the vulnerable.
Other Related Major Departments:
Urban Development, Agriculture, Horticulture, Animal Husbandry
SCs, OBCs  and Minority Affairs, Women  and  Child
Development  and Tribal Development.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of the population covered by social protection floors/systems, disaggregated by sex, and distinguishing children, the unemployed, old-age persons, persons with disabilities, pregnant women/ newborns, work injury victims, the poor and the vulnerable.

Goal: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
Targets: By 2030, ensure that all men and women, in particular the poor and the vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to basic services, ownership and control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources, appropriate new technology and financial services, including microfinance.
Other Related Major Departments: Urban Development, Agriculture, Horticulture, Animal Husbandry, Revenue, Forestry  and  Wild Life, Tribal Development.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of the population living in households with access to basic services.

Goal: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
Targets: By 2030, build the resilience of the poor and those in vulnerable situations and reduce their exposure and vulnerability to climate-related extreme events and other
Other Related Major Departments: Revenue  and  Disaster Management, Forestry and  Wild Life, Environment  and Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Number of deaths, missing people, injured, relocated or evacuated due to disasters per 100,000 people.

Goal: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
Targets: Create sound policy frameworks at the state level, based on pro-poor and gender- sensitive development strategies, to support accelerated investment in poverty eradication actions.
Other Related Major Departments:
Urban Development, Environment and Scientific Technology SCs, OBCs  and Minority  Affairs and
Women  and  Child Development.
Tentative Indicators: Number of state action plans related to multilateral /bilateral environmental agreements that support accelerated investment in actions that eradicate poverty and sustainably use natural resources.

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: By 2030, end hunger and ensure access by all people, in particular the poor and people in vulnerable situations, including infants, to safe, nutritious and sufficient food all year round.
Other Related Major Departments: Agriculture, Education, Women and  Child Development.
Tentative Indicators: Prevalence of undernourishment

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: By 2030, end hunger and ensure access by all people, in particular the poor and people in vulnerable situations, including infants, to safe, nutritious and sufficient food all year round.
Other Related Major Departments: Agriculture, Education, Women and  Child Development.
Tentative Indicators: Prevalence of moderate or severe food insecurity in the population, based on the Food Insecurity Experience Scale (FIES).

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: By 2030, end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving, by 2025, the internationally agreed targets on stunting and wasting in children under 5 years of age, and address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women and older persons.
Other Related Major Departments: Health  and  Family Welfare, Women  and Child Development, Education.
Tentative Indicators: Prevalence of stunting (height for age <-2 standard deviation from the median of the World Health Organization (WHO) Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age.

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: By 2030, end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving, by 2025, the internationally agreed targets on stunting and wasting in children under 5 years of age, and address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women and older persons.
Other Related Major Departments: Health  and  Family Welfare, Women  and Child Development, Education.
Tentative Indicators: Prevalence of malnutrition (weight for height. >+2 or <-2 standard deviation from the median of the WHO Child Growth Standards) among children under 5, disaggregated by type (wasting and overweight).

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: By 2030, double the agricultural productivity and incomes of small-scale food producers, in particular productive resources and inputs, knowledge, financial services, markets and opportunities for value addition and non-farm employment
Other Related Major Departments: Agriculture, Horticulture, Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and  Industries.
Tentative Indicators: Volume of production per labour unit by classes of farming /pastoral/forestry enterprise size.

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: By 2030, double the agricultural productivity and incomes of small-scale food producers, in particular productive resources and inputs, knowledge, financial services, markets and opportunities for value addition and non-farm employment
Other Related Major Departments: Agriculture, Horticulture, Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and  Industries.
Tentative Indicators: Total Factor Productivity

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: By 2030, ensure sustainable food production systems and implement resilient agricultural practices that increase productivity and production, that help maintain ecosystems, that strengthen capacity for adaptation to climate change, extreme weather, drought, flooding and other disasters and that progressively improve land and soil quality.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation  and  Public Health, Agriculture, Horticulture, Animal Husbandry.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of agricultural area under sustainable agricultural practices

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: By 2030, ensure sustainable food production systems and implement resilient agricultural practices that increase productivity and production, that help maintain ecosystems, that strengthen capacity for adaptation to climate change, extreme weather, drought, flooding and other disasters and that progressively improve land and soil quality.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation  and  Public Health, Agriculture, Horticulture, Animal Husbandry.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of agricultural households using irrigation systems compared to all agricultural households.

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: By 2030, ensure sustainable food production systems and implement resilient agricultural practices that increase productivity and production, that help maintain ecosystems, that strengthen capacity for adaptation to climate change, extreme weather, drought, flooding and other disasters and that progressively improve land and soil quality.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation  and  Public Health, Agriculture, Horticulture, Animal Husbandry.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of agricultural households.

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: By 2020, maintain the genetic diversity of seeds, cultivated plants and farmed and domesticated animals and their related wild species, including through soundly managed and diversified seed and plant banks at the national, regional and international levels, and promote access to and fair and equitable sharing of benefits arising from the utilization of genetic resources and associated traditional knowledge, as internationally agreed.
Other Related Major Departments: Agriculture, Horticulture, Animal Husbandry, Forestry and  Wild Life.
Tentative Indicators: Ex situ crop collections enrichment index.

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: By 2020, maintain the genetic diversity of seeds, cultivated plants and farmed and domesticated animals and their related wild species, including through soundly managed and diversified seed and plant banks at the national, regional and international levels, and promote access to and fair and equitable sharing of benefits arising from the utilization of genetic resources and associated traditional knowledge, as internationally agreed.
Other Related Major Departments: Agriculture, Horticulture, Animal Husbandry, Forestry and  Wild Life.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of local crops and breeds and their wild relatives, classified as being at risk, not-at-risk or at an unknown level of risk of extinction.

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: Increase investment, including through enhanced international cooperation, in rural infrastructure, agricultural research and extension services, technology development and plant and livestock gene banks in order to enhance agricultural productive capacity in developing countries, in particular least developed countries
Other Related Major Departments: Industries, Agriculture, Horticulture, Animal Husbandry.
Tentative Indicators: The agriculture orientation index for government expenditures.

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: Correct and prevent trade restrictions and distortions in agricultural markets,including through the parallel elimination of all forms of agricultural export subsidies and all export measures with equivalent effect, in accordance with the mandate of the Doha Development Round.
Other Related Major Departments:
Agriculture,
Horticulture.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage change in import and export tariffs on agricultural products.

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: Adopt measures to ensure the proper functioning of food commodity markets and their derivatives and facilitate timely access to market information, including on food reserves, in order to help limit extreme food price volatility.
Other Related Major Departments:
Agriculture,
Horticulture.
Tentative Indicators: Agricultural export subsidies.

Goal: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
Targets: Adopt measures to ensure the proper functioning of food commodity markets and their derivatives and facilitate timely access to market information, including on food reserves, in order to help limit extreme food price volatility.
Other Related Major Departments: Agriculture, Horticulture, Economics  and Statistics.
Tentative Indicators: Indicator of (food) price anomalies.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: By 2030, reduce the maternal mortality ratio to less than 70 per 100,000 live births.
Other Related Major Departments: Women  and  Child Development.
Tentative Indicators: Maternal deaths per 100,000 live births.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: By 2030, reduce the maternal mortality ratio to less than 70 per 100,000 live births.
Other Related Major Departments: Women  and  Child Development.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of births attended by skilled health personnel.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: By 2030, end preventable deaths of newborns and children under 5 years of age, aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to at least as low as 12 per 1,000 live births and under-5 mortality to at least as low as 25 per 1,000 live births.
Other Related Major Departments: Health  and  Family Welfare.
Tentative Indicators: Under-5 mortality rate (deaths per 1,000 live births).

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: By 2030, end preventable deaths of newborns and children under 5 years of age, aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to at least as low as 12 per 1,000 live births and under-5 mortality to at least as low as 25 per 1,000 live births.
Other Related Major Departments: Health  and  Family Welfare.
Tentative Indicators: Neonatal mortality rate (deaths per 1,000 live births).

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: By 2030, end the epidemics of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation and Public Health.
Tentative Indicators: Number of new HIV infection per 1000 uneffective population (by age group, sex & Key population)

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: By 2030, end the epidemics of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation and Public Health.
Tentative Indicators: Tuberculosis incidence per 1000 persons per year.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: By 2030, end the epidemics of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation and Public Health.
Tentative Indicators: Malria incidence cases per 1000 persons per year.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: By 2030, end the epidemics of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation and Public Health.
Tentative Indicators: Number of new Hepatitis B infections per one lakh population in a given year.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: Strengthen the prevention and treatment of substance abuse, including narcotic drug abuse and harmful use of alcohol.
Other Related Major Departments:
Health and Family
Welfare, Home.
Tentative Indicators: Coverage of treatment interventions (pharmacological, psychosocial and rehabilitation and aftercare services) for substance use disorders.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: Strengthen the prevention and treatment of substance abuse, including narcotic drug abuse and harmful use of alcohol.
Other Related Major Departments:
Health and Family
Welfare, Home.
Tentative Indicators: Harmful use of alcohol, defined according to the national context as alcohol per capita consumption (aged 15 years and older) within a calendar year in litres of pure alcohol.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: By 2020, halve the number of deaths and injuries from road traffic accidents.
Other Related Major Departments: Transport, Health and Family Welfare, Home.
Tentative Indicators: Number of road traffic fatal injury deaths within 30 days, per 100,000 population (age-standardized).

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: By 2030, ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health-care services, including for family planning, information and education, and the integration of reproductive health into national strategies and programmes.
Other Related Major Departments: Health and Family Welfare, Public Works.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of women of reproductive age (aged 15-49) who have their need for family planning satisfied with modern methods.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: By 2030, ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health-care services, including for family planning, information and education, and the integration of reproductive health into national strategies and programmes.
Other Related Major Departments: Health and Family Welfare, Public Works.
Tentative Indicators: Adolescent birth rate (aged 10-14; aged 15-19) per 1,000 women in that age group.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: Achieve universal health coverage, including financial risk protection, access to quality essential health-care services and access to safe, effective, quality and affordable essential medicines and vaccines for all.
Other Related Major Departments: Health and Family Welfare, Ayurveda.
Tentative Indicators: Coverage of tracer interventions (e.g. child full immunization, antiretroviral therapy, tuberculosis treatment, hypertension treatment, skilled attendant at birth, etc.).

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: Achieve universal health coverage, including financial risk protection, access to quality essential health-care services and access to safe, effective, quality and affordable essential medicines and vaccines for all.
Other Related Major Departments: Health and Family Welfare, Ayurveda.
Tentative Indicators: Fraction of the population protected against catastrophic/impoverishing out-of-pocket health expenditure.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: By 2030, substantially reduce the number of deaths and illnesses from hazardous chemicals and air, water and soil pollution and contamination.
Other Related Major Departments: Health and Family Welfare.
Tentative Indicators: Mortality rate attributed to household and ambient air pollution.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: By 2030, substantially reduce the number of deaths and illnesses from hazardous chemicals and air, water and soil pollution and contamination.
Other Related Major Departments: Health and Family Welfare.
Tentative Indicators: Mortality rate attributed to hazardous chemicals, water and soil pollution and contamination.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: Strengthen the implementation of the World Health Organization Framework Convention on Tobacco Control in all countries, as appropriate.
Other Related Major Departments:
Health and Family
Welfare, Ayurveda.
Tentative Indicators: Age-standardized prevalence of current tobacco use among persons aged 15 years and older.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: Support the research and development of vaccines and medicines for the communicable and non-communicable diseases that primarily affect developing countries, provide access to affordable essential medicines and vaccines, in accordance with the Doha Declaration on the TRIPS Agreement and Public Health, which affirms the right of developing countries to use to the full the provisions in the Agreement on Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights regarding flexibilities to protect public health, and, in particular, provide access to medicines for all.
Other Related Major Departments: Health and Family Welfare, Ayurveda.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of the population with access to affordable medicines and vaccines on a sustainable basis

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: Support the research and development of vaccines and medicines for the communicable and non-communicable diseases that primarily affect developing countries, provide access to affordable essential medicines and vaccines, in accordance with the Doha Declaration on the TRIPS Agreement and Public Health, which affirms the right of developing countries to use to the full the provisions in the Agreement on Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights regarding flexibilities to protect public health, and, in particular, provide access to medicines for all.
Other Related Major Departments: Health and Family Welfare, Ayurveda.
Tentative Indicators: Total net official development assistance to the medical research and basic health sectors.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: Substantially increase health financing and the recruitment, development, training and retention of the health workforce.
Other Related Major Departments: Health and Family Welfare, Ayurveda.
Tentative Indicators: Health worker density and distribution.

Goal: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Targets: Strengthen the capacity for early warning, risk reduction and management of local, National and global health risks.
Other Related Major Departments: Health & Family Welfare, Ayurveda
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of attributes of 13 core capacities that have been attained at a specific point in time.

Goal:
Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities
for all
Targets: By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys complete free, equitable and quality primary and secondary education leading to relevant and effective learning outcomes.
Other Related Major Departments: Elementary Education, Secondary and Higher Education .
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of children/young people: (a) in grades 2/3; (b) at the end of primary; and (c) at the end of lower secondary achieving at least a minimum proficiency level in (i) reading and (ii) mathematics. Disaggregations: sex, location, wealth (and others where data are available).

Goal:
Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities
for all
Targets: By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys have access to quality early childhood development, care and pre-primary education so that they are ready for primary education.
Other Related Major Departments: Elementary Education.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of children under 5 years of age who are developmentally on track in health, learning and psychosocial well-being. Disaggregations: sex, location, wealth (and others where data are available).

Goal:
Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities
for all
Targets: By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys have access to quality early childhood development, care and pre-primary education so that they are ready for primary education.
Other Related Major Departments: Elementary Education.
Tentative Indicators: Participation rate in organized learning (one year before the official primary entry age).

Goal:
Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities
for all
Targets: By 2030, ensure equal access for all women and men to affordable and quality technical, vocational and tertiary education, including university.
Other Related Major Departments: Education, Technical Education.
Tentative Indicators: Participation rate of youth and adults in formal and non-formal education and training in the last 12 months.

Goal:
Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities
for all
Targets: By 2030, substantially increase the number of youth and adults who have relevant skills, including technical and vocational skills, for employment, decent jobs and entrepreneurship.
Other Related Major Departments: Technical Education.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of youth/adults with information and communications technology (ICT) skills by type of skill.

Goal:
Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities
for all
Targets: By 2030, eliminate gender disparities in education and ensure equal access to all levels of education and vocational training for the vulnerable, including persons with disabilities, indigenous peoples and children in vulnerable situations.
Other Related Major Departments: Elementary Education, Higher education, Technical Education, Medical Education.
Tentative Indicators: Parity indices (female/male, rural/urban, bottom/top wealth quintile and others such as disability status, indigenous people and conflict-affected as data become available) for all indicators on this list that can be disaggregated.

Goal:
Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities
for all
Targets: By 2030, ensure that all youth and a substantial proportion of adults, both men and women, achieve literacy and numeracy.
Other Related Major Departments: Elementary Education, Secondary Education.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of population in a given age group achieving at least a fixed level of proficiency in functional (a) literacy and (b) numeracy skills. Disaggregations: sex, location, wealth (and others where data are available).

Goal:
Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities
for all
Targets: By 2030, ensure that all learners acquire the knowledge and skills needed to promote sustainable development, including, among others, through education for sustainable development and sustainable lifestyles, human rights, gender equality, promotion of a culture of peace and non-violence, global citizenship and appreciation of cultural diversity and of cultures contribution to sustainable development.
Other Related Major Departments: Secondary Education.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of 15-year-old students enrolled in secondary school demonstrating at least a fixed level of knowledge across a selection of topics in environmental science and geoscience. The exact choice/range of topics will depend on the survey or assessment in which the indicator is collected. Disaggregations: sex and location (and others where data are available)

Goal:
Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities
for all
Targets: Build and upgrade education facilities that are child, disability and gender sensitive and provide safe, non-violent, inclusive and effective learning environments for al.
Other Related Major Departments: Elementary Education, Higher Education, Technical Education .
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of schools with access to: (a) electricity; (b) the Internet for pedagogical purposes; (c) computers for pedagogical purposes; (d) adapted infrastructure and materials for students with disabilities; (e) single-sex basic sanitation facilities; and (f) basic handwashing facilities (as per the Water, Sanitation and Hygiene for All (WASH) indicator definitions).

Goal:
Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities
for all
Targets: By 2020, substantially expand the number of scholarships available for enrolment in higher education, including vocational training and information and communications technology, technical, engineering and scientific programmes.
Other Related Major Departments: Elementary Education, Higher Education, Technical Education, Medical Education.
Tentative Indicators: Volume of official development assistance flows for scholarships by sector and type of study.

Goal:
Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities
for all
Targets: By 2030, substantially increase the supply of qualified teachers, including through international cooperation for teacher training.
Other Related Major Departments: Elementary Education, Higher Education, Technical Education, Vocational Education.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of teachers in: (a) pre- primary; (b) primary; (c) lower secondary; and (d) upper secondary education who have received at least the minimum organized teacher training (e.g. pedagogical training) pre-service or in-service required for teaching at the relevant level in the State Disaggregations: sex (and others where data are available).

Goal:
Achieve gender equality and empower all women and
girls
Targets: End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
Other Related Major Departments: SCs, OBCs & Minority Affairs, Tribal Development, Women & Child Development.
Tentative Indicators: Whether or not legal frameworks are in place to promote, enforce and monitor equality and non- discrimination on the basis of sex.

Goal:
Achieve gender equality and empower all women and
girls
Targets: Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.
Other Related Major Departments: Women & Child Development, Home.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of ever-partnered women and girls aged 15 years and older subjected to physical, sexual or psychological violence by a current or former intimate partner, in the last 12 months, by form of violence and by age group.

Goal:
Achieve gender equality and empower all women and
girls
Targets: Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.
Other Related Major Departments: Women & Child Development, Home.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of women and girls aged 15 years and older subjected to sexual violence by persons other than an intimate partner, in the last 12 months, by age group and place of occurrence.

Goal:
Achieve gender equality and empower all women and
girls
Targets: Eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation.
Other Related Major Departments: Women & Child Development.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of women aged 20-24 who were married or in a union before age 15 and before age 18.

Goal:
Achieve gender equality and empower all women and
girls
Targets: Eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation.
Other Related Major Departments: Women & Child Development.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of girls and women aged 15-49 who have undergone female genital mutilation/cutting, by age group.

Goal:
Achieve gender equality and empower all women and
girls
Targets: Recognize and value unpaid care and domestic work through the provision of public services, infrastructure and social protection policies and the promotion of shared responsibility within the household and the family as appropriate.
Other Related Major Departments: Women & Child Development, Economics & Statistics.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of time spent on unpaid domestic and care work, by sex, age group and location.

Goal:
Achieve gender equality and empower all women and
girls
Targets: Ensure womens full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
Other Related Major Departments: Women & Child Development, Panchayati Raj, Urban Development.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of seats held by women in national parliaments and local governments.

Goal:
Achieve gender equality and empower all women and
girls
Targets: Ensure womens full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
Other Related Major Departments: Women & Child Development, Panchayati Raj, Urban Development.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of women in managerial positions.

Goal:
Achieve gender equality and empower all women and
girls
Targets: Ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health and reproductive rights as agreed in accordance with the Programme of Action of the International Conference on Population and Development and the Beijing Platform for Action and the outcome documents of their review conferences.
Other Related Major Departments: Women & Child Development, Health and Family Welfare.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of women aged 15-49 who make their own informed decisions regarding sexual relations, contraceptive use and reproductive health care.

Goal:
Achieve gender equality and empower all women and
girls
Targets: Ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health and reproductive rights as agreed in accordance with the Programme of Action of the International Conference on Population and Development and the Beijing Platform for Action and the outcome documents of their review conferences.
Other Related Major Departments: Women & Child Development, Health and Family Welfare.
Tentative Indicators: Number of countries with laws and regulations that guarantee women aged 15-49 access to sexual and reproductive health care, information and education.

Goal:
Achieve gender equality and empower all women and
girls
Targets: Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.
Other Related Major Departments: Women & Child Development, Revenue.
Tentative Indicators: (a) Percentage of people with ownership or secure rights over agricultural land (out of total agricultural population), by sex; and (b) share of women among owners or rights-bearers of agricultural land, by type of tenure.

Goal:
Achieve gender equality and empower all women and
girls
Targets: Enhance the use of enabling technology, in particular information and communications technology, to promote the empowerment of women.
Other Related Major Departments: Information Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of individuals who own a mobile telephone, by sex.

Goal:
Achieve gender equality and empower all women and
girls
Targets: Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
Other Related Major Departments: SCs, OBCs & Minority Affairs ,Women & Child Development.
Tentative Indicators: Systems to track and make public allocations for gender equality and womens empowerment.

Goal: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Targets: By 2030, achieve universal and equitable access to safe and affordable drinking water for all.
Other Related Major Departments:
Irrigation & Public Health, Panchayati Raj, Urban
Development.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of population using safely managed drinking water services.

Goal: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Targets: By 2030, achieve access to adequate and equitable sanitation and hygiene for all and end open defecation, paying special attention to the needs of women and girls and those in vulnerable situations.
Other Related Major Departments:
Irrigation & Public Health, Panchayati Raj, Urban
Development  and Health.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of population using safely managed sanitation services, including a hand-washing facility with soap and water.

Goal: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Targets: By 2030, improve water quality by reducing pollution, eliminating dumping and minimizing release of hazardous chemicals and materials, halving the proportion of untreated wastewater and substantially increasing recycling and safe reuse.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation & Public Health, Panchayati Raj, Urban Development,  Health and Family Welfare.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of wastewater safely treated.

Goal: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Targets: By 2030, improve water quality by reducing pollution, eliminating dumping and minimizing release of hazardous chemicals and materials, halving the proportion of untreated wastewater and substantially increasing recycling and safe reuse.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation & Public Health, Panchayati Raj, Urban Development,  Health and Family Welfare.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of bodies of water with good ambient water quality.

Goal: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Targets: By 2030, substantially increase water-use efficiency across all sectors and ensure sustainable withdrawals and supply of freshwater to address water scarcity and substantially reduce the number of people suffering from water scarcity.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation and  Public Health, Environment & Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage change in water use efficiency over time.

Goal: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Targets: By 2030, substantially increase water-use efficiency across all sectors and ensure sustainable withdrawals and supply of freshwater to address water scarcity and substantially reduce the number of people suffering from water scarcity.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation and  Public Health, Environment & Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of total available water resources used, taking environmental water requirements into account (level of water stress).

Goal: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Targets: By 2030, implement integrated water resources management at all levels, including through transboundary cooperation as appropriate.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation & Public Health.
Tentative Indicators: Degree of integrated water resources management implementation (0- 100).

Goal: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Targets: By 2020, protect and restore water-related ecosystems, including mountains, forests, wetlands, rivers, aquifers and lakes.
Other Related Major Departments:
Irrigation & Public Health, Environment & Scientific
Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of change in the extent of water-related ecosystems over time.

Goal: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Targets: By 2030, expand international cooperation and capacity-building support to in water- and sanitation-related activities and programmes, including water harvesting, desalination, water efficiency, wastewater treatment, recycling and reuse technologies.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation & Public Health, Agriculture, Urban Development & Panchayati Raj.
Tentative Indicators: Amount of water-and sanitation- related official development assistance that is part of a government coordinated spending plan.

Goal: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Targets: Support and strengthen the participation of local communities in improving water and sanitation management.
Other Related Major Departments: Irrigation & Public Health, Agriculture, Urban Development, Panchayati Raj.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of total projects/schemes run and managed by participation of local communities with established and operational policies and procedures for participation of local communities in water and sanitation management.

Goal:
Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy
for all
Targets: By 2030, ensure universal access to affordable, reliable and modern energy services.
Other Related Major Departments: Energy.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of household with access to electricity.

Goal:
Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy
for all
Targets: By 2030, ensure universal access to affordable, reliable and modern energy services.
Other Related Major Departments: Energy.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of household with primary reliance on clean fuels and technology.

Goal:
Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy
for all
Targets: By 2030, increase substantially the share of renewable energy in the global energy mix.
Other Related Major Departments: Energy.
Tentative Indicators: Renewable energy share in the total final energy consumption.

Goal:
Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy
for all
Targets: By 2030, double the global rate of improvement in energy efficiency.
Other Related Major Departments: Energy.
Tentative Indicators: Energy intensity measured in terms of primary energy and gross domestic product (GDP).

Goal:
Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy
for all
Targets: By 2030, enhance international cooperation to facilitate access to clean energy research and technology, including renewable energy, energy efficiency and advanced and cleaner fossil-fuel technology, and promote investment in energy infrastructure and clean energy technology.
Other Related Major Departments: Energy.
Tentative Indicators: Mobilized amount of United States dollars per year.

Goal:
Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy
for all
Targets: By 2030, expand infrastructure and upgrade technology for supplying modern and sustainable energy services for all in accordance with their respective programmes of support.
Other Related Major Departments: Energy.
Tentative Indicators: Ratio of value added to net domestic energy use, by industry.

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: Sustain per capita economic growth in accordance with national circumstances and, in particular, at least 7 per cent gross domestic product growth per annum in the least developed countries.
Other Related Major Departments: Planning, Economics and  Statistics.
Tentative Indicators: Annual growth rate of real GDP per capita.

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: Achieve higher levels of economic productivity through diversification, technological upgrading and innovation, including through a focus on high-value added and labour-intensive sectors.
Other Related Major Departments: Planning, Economics and  Statistics.
Tentative Indicators: Annual growth rate of real GDP per employed person.

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small-and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.
Other Related Major Departments: Planning, Economics and  Statistics.
Tentative Indicators: Share of informal employment in non-agriculture employment, by sex.

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: Improve progressively, through 2030, global resource efficiency in consumption and production and endeavour to decouple economic growth from environmental degradation, in accordance with the 10- Year Framework of Programmes on Sustainable Consumption and Production, with developed countries taking the lead.
Other Related Major Departments: Economics  and Statistics, Environment and Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Resource productivity.

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: By 2030, achieve full and productive employment and decent work for all women and men, including for young people and persons with disabilities, and equal pay for work of equal value.
Other Related Major Departments: SCs, OBCs  and Minority  Affairs, Economics  and Statistics.
Tentative Indicators: Average hourly earnings of female and male employees, by occupation, age group and persons with disabilities.

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: By 2030, achieve full and productive employment and decent work for all women and men, including for young people and persons with disabilities, and equal pay for work of equal value.
Other Related Major Departments: SCs, OBCs  and Minority  Affairs, Economics  and Statistics.
Tentative Indicators: Unemployment rate, by sex, age group and persons with disabilities.

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: By 2020, substantially reduce the proportion of youth not in employment, education or training.
Other Related Major Departments: Planning.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of youth (aged 15-24) not in education, employment or training.

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: Take immediate and effective measures to eradicate forced labour, end modern slavery and human trafficking and secure the prohibition and elimination of the worst forms of child labour, including recruitment and use of child soldiers, and by 2025 end child labour in all its forms.
Other Related Major Departments: SCs, OBCs  and Minority  Affairs, Women and  Child Development, Economics and Statistics.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage and number of children aged 5-17 engaged in child labour, by sex and age group.

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: Protect labour rights and promote safe and secure working environments for all workers, including migrant workers, in particular women migrants, and those in precarious employment.
Other Related Major Departments: Labour  and Employment, Economics  and Statistics.
Tentative Indicators: Frequency rates of fatal and non- fatal occupational injuries, by sex and migrant status.

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: Protect labour rights and promote safe and secure working environments for all workers, including migrant workers, in particular women migrants, and those in precarious employment.
Other Related Major Departments: Labour  and Employment, Economics  and Statistics.
Tentative Indicators: Number of International Labour Organization (ILO) Conventions ratified, by type of convention.

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: By 2030, devise and implement policies to promote sustainable tourism that creates jobs and promotes local culture and products.
Other Related Major Departments: Tourism, Economics and  Statistics.
Tentative Indicators: Tourism direct GDP (as a percentage of total GDP and in growth rate); and number of jobs in tourism industries (as a percentage of total jobs and growth rate of jobs, by sex)

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: Strengthen the capacity of domestic financial institutions to encourage and expand access to banking, insurance and financial services for all.
Other Related Major Departments: Finance (Institutional Finance).
Tentative Indicators: Number of commercial bank branches and automated teller machines (ATMs) per 100,000 adults.

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: Strengthen the capacity of domestic financial institutions to encourage and expand access to banking, insurance and financial services for all.
Other Related Major Departments: Finance (Institutional Finance).
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of adults (15 years and older) with an account at a bank or other financial institution or with a mobile money service provider.

Goal: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
Targets: By 2020, develop and operationalize a strategy for youth employment and implement the Jobs Pact with Labour Organization.
Other Related Major Departments: SCs, OBCs and Minority Affairs, Labour and Employment, Economics and Statistics.
Tentative Indicators: Total government spending in social protection and employment programmes as a percentage of the national budgets and GDP.

Goal: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrializatio n and foster innovation
Targets: Develop quality, reliable, sustainable and resilient infrastructure, including regional and transborder infrastructure, to support economic development and human well- being, with a focus on affordable and equitable access for all.
Other Related Major Departments: Public Works Transport.
Tentative Indicators: Share of the rural population who live within 2 km of an all-season road.

Goal: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrializatio n and foster innovation
Targets: Develop quality, reliable, sustainable and resilient infrastructure, including regional and transborder infrastructure, to support economic development and human well- being, with a focus on affordable and equitable access for all.
Other Related Major Departments: Public Works Transport.
Tentative Indicators: Passenger and freight volumes, by mode of transport.

Goal: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrializatio n and foster innovation
Targets: Promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and, by 2030, significantly raise industrys share of employment and gross domestic product, in line with national circumstances, and double its share in least developed countries.
Other Related Major Departments: Industries.
Tentative Indicators: Manufacturing employment as a percentage of total employment.

Goal: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrializatio n and foster innovation
Targets: Increase the access of small-scale industrial and other enterprises, in particular in developing countries, to financial services, including affordable credit, and their integration into value chains and markets.
Other Related Major Departments: Industries.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage share of small-scale industries in total industry value added.

Goal: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrializatio n and foster innovation
Targets: Increase the access of small-scale industrial and other enterprises, in particular in developing countries, to financial services, including affordable credit, and their integration into value chains and markets.
Other Related Major Departments: Industries.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of small-scale industries with a loan or line of credit.

Goal: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrializatio n and foster innovation
Targets: By 2030, upgrade infrastructure and retrofit industries to make them sustainable, with increased resource-use efficiency and greater adoption of clean and environmentally sound technologies and industrial processes, with all countries taking action in accordance with their respective capabilities.
Other Related Major Departments: Industries, Environment  and Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: CO2 emission per unit of value added.

Goal: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrializatio n and foster innovation
Targets: Enhance scientific research, upgrade the technological capabilities of industrial sectors in all countries, in particular developing countries, including, by 2030, encouraging innovation and substantially increasing the number of research and development workers per 1 million people and public and private research and development spending.
Other Related Major Departments: Industries, Environment and Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Research and development expenditure as a percentage of GDP

Goal: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrializatio n and foster innovation
Targets: Enhance scientific research, upgrade the technological capabilities of industrial sectors in all countries, in particular developing countries, including, by 2030, encouraging innovation and substantially increasing the number of research and development workers per 1 million people and public and private research and development spending.
Other Related Major Departments: Industries, Environment and Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Researchers (in full-time equivalent) per million inhabitants.

Goal: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrializatio n and foster innovation
Targets: Facilitate sustainable and resilient infrastructure development through enhanced financial, technological and technical support.
Other Related Major Departments:
Public Works, Industries, Irrigation and Public Health,
Energy.
Tentative Indicators: %age of budgetary outlays for infrastructural development

Goal: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrializatio n and foster innovation
Targets: Support domestic technology development, research and innovation by ensuring a conducive policy environment for, inter alia, industrial diversification and value addition to commodities.
Other Related Major Departments: Industries.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of medium and high-tech industry value added in total value added.

Goal: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrializatio n and foster innovation
Targets: Significantly increase access to information and communications technology and strive to provide universal and affordable access to the Internet.
Other Related Major Departments: Information Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of population covered by a mobile network, by technology.

Goal: Reduce inequality within the State
Targets: By 2030, progressively achieve and sustain income growth of the bottom 40 per cent of the population at a rate higher than the national average.
Other Related Major Departments:
Rural Development, Urban Development, Agriculture,
Horticulture, Animal Husbandry.
Tentative Indicators: rates of household expenditure or income per capita among the bottom 40 per cent of the population and the total population.

Goal: Reduce inequality within the State
Targets: By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.
Other Related Major Departments:
Rural Development, Urban Development, Agriculture, Horticulture, Animal Husbandry, Elections,
Panchayati  Raj.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of people living below 50 per cent of median income, disaggregated by age group, sex and persons with disabilities.

Goal: Reduce inequality within the State
Targets: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.
Other Related Major Departments: Rural Development, Urban Development, Agriculture, Horticulture, Animal Husbandry, SCs, OBCs  and Minority Affairs, Tribal Development.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of the population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed within the last 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law.

Goal: Reduce inequality within the State
Targets: Adopt policies, especially fiscal, wage and social protection policies, and progressively achieve greater equality.
Other Related Major Departments:
Finance, Planning, Labour  and Employment SCs, OBCs  and  Minority Affairs, Women and Child Development, Tribal Development, Agriculture, Horticulture,  Animal
Husbandry.
Tentative Indicators: Labour share of GDP, comprising wages and social protection transfers.

Goal:
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe,
resilient and sustainable
Targets: By 2030, ensure access for all to adequate, safe and affordable housing and basic services and upgrade slums.
Other Related Major Departments:
Urban Development, Public Works, Irrigation  and Public Health, Transport,
Home, Town and Country Planning.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of urban population living in slums, informal settlements or inadequate housing.

Goal:
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe,
resilient and sustainable
Targets: By 2030, provide access to safe, affordable, accessible and sustainable transport systems for all, improving road safety, notably by expanding public transport, with special attention to the needs of those in vulnerable situations, women, children, persons with disabilities and older persons.
Other Related Major Departments: Urban Development, Transport, Home, Town  and  Country Planning, SCs, OBCs and  Minority  Affairs, Women  and  Child Development.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of the population that has convenient access to public transport, disaggregated by age group, sex and persons with disabilities.

Goal:
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe,
resilient and sustainable
Targets: By 2030, enhance inclusive and sustainable urbanization and capacity for participatory, integrated and sustainable human settlement planning and management.
Other Related Major Departments: Urban Development, Home, Town  and Country Planning, Revenue.
Tentative Indicators: Ratio of land consumption rate to population growth rate.

Goal:
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe,
resilient and sustainable
Targets: By 2030, enhance inclusive and sustainable urbanization and capacity for participatory, integrated and sustainable human settlement planning and management.
Other Related Major Departments: Urban Development, Home, Town  and Country Planning, Revenue.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of cities with a direct participation structure of civil society in urban planning and management which operate regularly and democratically.

Goal:
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe,
resilient and sustainable
Targets: Strengthen efforts to protect and safeguard the worlds cultural and natural heritage.
Other Related Major Departments:
Urban Development, Language Art  and Culture, Town  and
Country Planning.
Tentative Indicators: Share of municipal budget which is dedicated to the preservation, protection and conservation of state/national cultural natural heritage, including World Heritage sites.

Goal:
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe,
resilient and sustainable
Targets: By 2030, significantly reduce the number of deaths and the number of people affected and substantially decrease the direct economic losses relative to gross domestic product caused by disasters, including water-related disasters, with a focus on protecting the poor and people in vulnerable situations.
Other Related Major Departments: Urban Development, Health and Family Welfare, Revenue, Disaster Management.
Tentative Indicators: Number of deaths, missing people, injured, relocated or evacuated due to disasters per 100,000 people.

Goal:
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe,
resilient and sustainable
Targets: By 2030, reduce the adverse per capita environmental impact of cities, including by paying special attention to air quality and municipal and other waste management.
Other Related Major Departments: Urban Development, Environment  and Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of urban solid waste regularly collected and with adequate final discharge with regard to the total waste generated by the city.

Goal:
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe,
resilient and sustainable
Targets: By 2030, reduce the adverse per capita environmental impact of cities, including by paying special attention to air quality and municipal and other waste management.
Other Related Major Departments: Urban Development, Environment  and Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Annual mean levels of fine particulate matter (e.g. PM2.5 and PM10) in cities (population weighted).

Goal:
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe,
resilient and sustainable
Targets: By 2030, provide universal access to safe, inclusive and accessible, green and public spaces, in particular for women and children, older persons and persons with disabilities.
Other Related Major Departments: Urban Development, Home, Forestry  and Wild Life.
Tentative Indicators: The average share of the built-up area of cities that is open space for public use for all, disaggregated by age group, sex and persons with disabilities.

Goal:
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe,
resilient and sustainable
Targets: By 2030, provide universal access to safe, inclusive and accessible, green and public spaces, in particular for women and children, older persons and persons with disabilities.
Other Related Major Departments: Urban Development, Home, Forestry  and Wild Life.
Tentative Indicators: Proportion of women subjected to physical or sexual harassment, by perpetrator and place of occurrence (last 12 months).

Goal:
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe,
resilient and sustainable
Targets: Support positive economic, social and environmental links between urban, peri- urban and rural areas by strengthening national and regional development planning.
Other Related Major Departments: Urban Development, Town  and  Country Planning.
Tentative Indicators: Cities with more than 100,000 inhabitants that implement urban and regional development plans integrating population projections and resource needs.

Goal:
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe,
resilient and sustainable
Targets: By 2020, substantially increase the number of cities and human settlements adopting and implementing integrated policies and plans towards inclusion, resource efficiency, mitigation and adaptation to climate change, resilience to disasters, and develop and implement, in line with the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction 2015-2030, holistic disaster risk management at all levels.
Other Related Major Departments:
Urban Development, Town  and  Country
Planning, Revenue, Disaster Management, Home.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of cities that are implementing risk reduction and resilience strategies aligned with accepted international frameworks (such as the successor to the Hyogo Framework for Action 2005-2015 on disaster risk reduction) that include vulnerable and marginalized groups in their design, implementation and monitoring.

Goal:
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe,
resilient and sustainable
Targets: Support through financial and technical assistance, in building sustainable and resilient buildings utilizing local materials.
Other Related Major Departments:
Urban Development, Town and Country Planning, Public
Works.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of financial support that is allocated to the construction and retrofitting of sustainable, resilient and resource-efficient buildings.

Goal:
Ensure sustainable consumption and production
patterns
Targets: By 2030, achieve the sustainable management and efficient use of natural resources
Other Related Major Departments: Environment and Scientific Technology, Forestry and Wild Life.
Tentative Indicators: Material footprint and material footprint per capita.

Goal:
Ensure sustainable consumption and production
patterns
Targets: By 2030, halve per capita food waste at the retail and consumer levels and reduce food losses along production and supply chains, including post-harvest losses.
Other Related Major Departments: Environment and Scientific Technology, Agriculture, Horticulture.
Tentative Indicators: Global food loss index.

Goal:
Ensure sustainable consumption and production
patterns
Targets: By 2020, achieve the environmentally sound management of chemicals and all wastes throughout their life cycle, in accordance with agreed international frameworks, and significantly reduce their release to air, water and soil in order to minimize their adverse impacts on human health and the environment.
Other Related Major Departments: Environment and Scientific Technology, Agriculture, Horticulture, Health and Family Welfare, Urban Development, Panchayati Raj.
Tentative Indicators: Number of parties to international multilateral environmental agreements on hazardous and other chemicals and waste that meet their commitments and obligations in transmitting information as required by each relevant agreement.

Goal:
Ensure sustainable consumption and production
patterns
Targets: By 2020, achieve the environmentally sound management of chemicals and all wastes throughout their life cycle, in accordance with agreed international frameworks, and significantly reduce their release to air, water and soil in order to minimize their adverse impacts on human health and the environment.
Other Related Major Departments: Environment and Scientific Technology, Agriculture, Horticulture, Health and Family Welfare, Urban Development, Panchayati Raj.
Tentative Indicators: Treatment of waste, generation of hazardous waste, hazardous waste management, by type of treatment.

Goal:
Ensure sustainable consumption and production
patterns
Targets: By 2030, substantially reduce waste generation through prevention, reduction, recycling and reuse.
Other Related Major Departments:
Environment  and
Scientific Technology, Urban Development, Panchayati Raj.
Tentative Indicators: National recycling rate, tons of material recycled.

Goal:
Ensure sustainable consumption and production
patterns
Targets: Encourage companies, especially large and transnational companies, to adopt sustainable practices and to integrate sustainability information into their reporting cycle.
Other Related Major Departments: Environment  and Scientific Technology, Industries.
Tentative Indicators: Number of companies publishing sustainability reports.

Goal:
Ensure sustainable consumption and production
patterns
Targets: Promote public procurement practices that are sustainable, in accordance with national policies and priorities.
Other Related Major Departments:
Environment and Scientific Technology, Information
Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Number of departments implementing sustainable public procurement policies and action plans.

Goal:
Ensure sustainable consumption and production
patterns
Targets: By 2030, ensure that people everywhere have the relevant information and awareness for sustainable development and lifestyles in harmony with nature.
Other Related Major Departments:
Environment  and Scientific Technology, Education, Technical
Education, Medical Education.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of educational institutions with formal and informal education curricula on sustainable development and lifestyle topics.

Goal:
Ensure sustainable consumption and production
patterns
Targets: Support to strengthen scientific and technological capacity to move towards more sustainable patterns of consumption and production.
Other Related Major Departments:
Environment  and Scientific Technology,
State Council for Science Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Number of qualified green patent applications over total.

Goal:
Ensure sustainable consumption and production
patterns
Targets: Develop and implement tools to monitor sustainable development impacts for sustainable tourism that creates jobs and promotes local culture and products.
Other Related Major Departments: Environment  and Scientific Technology, Tourism.
Tentative Indicators: Residual flows generated as a result of tourism; direct GDP.

Goal: Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts
Targets: Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries.
Other Related Major Departments:
Environment  and Scientific Technology, Revenue, Disaster
Management
Tentative Indicators: Number of deaths, missing people, injured, relocated or evacuated due to disasters per 100,000 people.

Goal: Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts
Targets: Integrate climate change measures into national policies, strategies and planning.
Other Related Major Departments: Environment & Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Number of departments that have formally communicated the establishment of integrated low- carbon, climate-resilient, disaster risk reduction development strategies (e.g. a state adaptation plan process, national policies and measures to promote the transition to environmentally friendly substances and technologies).

Goal: Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts
Targets: Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning.
Other Related Major Departments: Environment and Scientific Technology, Education, Technical Education.
Tentative Indicators: Number of institutions that have integrated mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning into primary, secondary and tertiary curricula.

Goal:
Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity
loss
Targets: By 2020, ensure the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of terrestrial and inland freshwater ecosystems and their services, in particular forests, wetlands, mountains and dry lands, in line with obligations under international agreements.
Other Related Major Departments: Forestry & Wild Life, Environment & Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Forest area as a percentage of total land area.

Goal:
Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity
loss
Targets: By 2020, promote the implementation of sustainable management of all types of forests, halt deforestation, restore degraded forests and substantially increase afforestation and reforestation globally.
Other Related Major Departments: Forestry  and Wild Life, Environment and Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Forest cover under sustainable forest management.

Goal:
Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity
loss
Targets: By 2020, promote the implementation of sustainable management of all types of forests, halt deforestation, restore degraded forests and substantially increase afforestation and reforestation globally.
Other Related Major Departments: Forestry  and Wild Life, Environment and Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Net permanent forest loss.

Goal:
Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity
loss
Targets: By 2030, combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods, and strive to achieve a land degradation-neutral world.
Other Related Major Departments: Forestry  and Wild Life, Revenue.
Tentative Indicators: Percentage of land that is degraded over total land area.

Goal:
Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity
loss
Targets: By 2030, ensure the conservation of mountain ecosystems, including their biodiversity, in order to enhance their capacity to provide benefits that are essential for sustainable development.
Other Related Major Departments:
Forestry & Wild Life, Environment &
Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Coverage by protected areas of important sites for mountain biodiversity.

Goal:
Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity
loss
Targets: By 2030, ensure the conservation of mountain ecosystems, including their biodiversity, in order to enhance their capacity to provide benefits that are essential for sustainable development.
Other Related Major Departments:
Forestry & Wild Life, Environment &
Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Mountain Green Cover Index.

Goal:
Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity
loss
Targets: Take urgent and significant action to reduce the degradation of natural habitats, halt the loss of biodiversity and, by 2020, protect and prevent the extinction of threatened species
Other Related Major Departments: Forestry  and  Wild Life, Environment and  Scientific Technology.
Tentative Indicators: Red List Index.

Goal:
Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity
loss
Targets: Promote fair and equitable sharing of the benefits arising from the utilization of genetic resources and promote appropriate access to such resources, as internationally agreed.
Other Related Major Departments: Forestry  and  Wild Life, Agriculture and Horticulture.
